taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family ORCHIDACEAE;tribe CRANICHIDEAE;subtribe SPIRANTHINAE;genus Schiedeella;species arizonica;

bio:treatment.discussion: Plants of Schiedeella arizonica from the southwestern United States were originally identified as Spiranthes parasitica A. Richard & Galeotti by C. A. Luer (1975), and as Schiedeella parasitica (A. Richard & Galeotti) Schlechter by J. Liggio and A. Liggio (1999).Â Meanwhile P. M. Brown (1996) treated them as S. fauci-sanguinea (Dod) Burns-Balogh. Neither of those species actually occurs in the United States, and Brown later described the taxon as Schiedeella arizonica.
